metadata.title: CVE-2017-13803 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11.1 isaffected. Safari before 11.0.1 is affected. iCloud before 7.1 on Windows isaffected. iTunes before 12.7.1 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11.1 isaffected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and application crash) via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13803` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.3-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.3-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.3-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.18.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.3-1').
qtwebkit-source package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
